review: This place is just amazing. I need to come back ASAP. This was my first time and it was a great experience. Yes it's small and they stack the tables on top of each other but it makes you feel like you're in New York. The server Rainbow was super nice and just perfect!! She was super sweet as well.  I signed up on the app before I came and they give you a free small plate. Ordered the quesadillas which were delicious even though they had black beans in it, which I hate. The ranch sauce was delicious as well, I think it had chipotle in it. Saved that for the pizza too. The BBQ chicken pizza was just perfect. The chicken was nice and soft and the BBQ sauce was nice and sweet with a slight tang. It was a great choice. Next time I come I have to get the cheese and tomato one. When Rainbow brought the check she also placed hand sanitizer on the table that smelled like beautiful oranges lol. It was lovely.

I absolutely love CPK. The food is great, the drinks are awesome and the atmosphere is always relaxed & not loud at all. It is a great place to take someone on a first date, or simply for an afternoon meal/drinks with friends.  Both locations I visited(NJ&NYC)had great waiters and they were highly professional. No complaints about the service.  Overall CPK is a great restaurant, I personally don't find anything wrong with it.
Awesome service (Thanks Steve @ the bar) quick and tasty. We were in and out and the meal hit the spot.

Service was okish, food was great.  They did have a lot of customers at the time, so I can understand the food taking longer than usual to prepare. However, I would have preferred it if the server didn't just ignore me until I could get close enough to talk to me even though they weren't helping anyone. Waitstaff seemed pleasant, cheerful, and quite helpful though. Been to CPK many times, always for a thin crust pizza. They are extremely consistent in quality and taste and the food is well worth the cost.

Just your typical CPK. This place is newly refinished so everything is new and clean which is great. Food was as expected, delicious and cooked perfectly. They have some new menu items which is always nice. Service was quick and friendly. Cant ask for anything else.

Really CPK....what happened...We have been repeat customers of CPK from the beginning.Moved away but when back in the area we stop in....it has been a while since our last visit..and was not crazy about it then...stopped in on a Friday night at 8pm.....as soon as our waitress came over to the table I knew something was wrong...she told us that they were out of and running out of items on the menu...restaurant was packed like it always used to be...so we ordered 2 sodas and started looking at the menu....WHAT HAPPEN TO THE PIZZA that was in the middle of the menu..it's now off to the right side corner..replaced by chicken dishes and a rib eye steak...I asked the waitress if they had the BLT pizza which was delicious..she said no, they removed it from the menu...WHY...( to difficult to make) I don't get it....so we ordered 2 petite wedge salads...joke...I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and my wife ordered fettuccine with shrimp and veggies..when the meals arrived my chicken salad was ok..chicken was dry..my wife had to send her dish back because the shrimp (tiny) were raw...waitress felt really bad because I'm sure she was not having a good night...when she came back she said that was the last of the shrimp and that dish...so my wife ordered a cup of soup....we then asked for the check 42.60 without the tip...I don't know about you but it's not what it used to be...bring back your Orignal menu...the BLT Pizza and bring back the PIZZA in CPK....

This is one of the nicer CPK's that I've been to. The wait was a little shorter than stated (10 instead of 15), which did mean we needed to stick close by since they would've given our table away. We were looking at the menu while we waited, so we ready to order when our server Gabby came by. It was a pretty basic experience for a chain restaurant. Definitely a nice option for a sit down place after walking around the mall. However, if you get a table (opposed to a booth) there isn't much space to put any shopping bags.
There's always a wait at this location. How to get around it? Sit at the bar! Sangria, soup, an salad within 5 minutes. Everything you need to recharge for more shopping!
Came in at opening being 11:00 am no wait time, checked in using their points and doing a Diet Coke plus soup and pizza.

This location is definitely a tightly-packed place, so try to ask for a booth instead of one of their tables. Their margherita pizza is one of the best I've had from a restaurant. I recommend getting the caesar salad with it, too.

3 hours for delivery service... horrible!!!!! Keep in mind it was being delivered only on the other side of the high way. Then I was talked to as if I was wrong for being upset that it took 3 hours to get food that I paid $60 for. They wrote my credit card number down and told me they do it all time. Came 3 hours later and with no receipt. Dropped the food and left. The manager was extremely sincere and apologetic. However the staff needs a retrain on how to deal with people in general. I was told well you know delivery does take a long time. I said yes it does but not 3 hours. Took at least 45 minutes to place the order since I was placed on hold for 45 minutes. I had to hang up and call back 3 times because everyone that put me on hold forgot about me. Maybe 2 hours at most. Never again!!!
Great food , always happy to come here , so many healthy options to choose from , they even offer gluten free pizza !

Came here on a Thursday night with a friend around 8 PM. We called around 715 to sign up on their "waiting list" and were seated within 2 minutes. For appetizers we ordered the tortilla spring rolls (basil & thai chicken) and they came with a sauce (which I didn't particularly care for) and guacamole that was surprisingly spicy & tasty. We ordered 2 pizzas between us two, and went with a whole wheat tostada and a thin crust sicillian. The tostada comes with a refreshing tomato salsa & has the option of adding lime roasted chicken. The sicillian was very good w/ a sweet tomato sauce that went perfectly with the salty meat on the pizza. The tostada was especially crispy topped with a perfect ammount of crunchy & fresh lettuce. For dessert we shared the chocolate brownie souffle & ice cream and it was delicious! All in all I was very happy with my meal!

Really disappointed. The Waldorf salad from CPK is one of my favorite salads and was much looking forward to having one. Went to the GSP location and was pleasantly surprised when we were seated right away. However, after we were seated we waited... and waited... and waited. Servers were all around us, bustling past us but we never got one to stop. We watched as others were seated and promptly received their drinks and their food.  In the end we just walked out. No server, no water even, and no salad. I will seek out another location for my salad fix. I will not be returning to this location.

Ambiance/Decor/Atmosphere: Slightly on the boring side; almost diner like with the wood tables and brown color all over.  The tile pizza oven area is pretty eye catching, and there is a counter in front where you can sit and watch people cook.  The counter is a hit and a miss at the same time to me; it seems like a bar to drink at, but at the same time where you'd eat at in a diner.  I'm not sure if a diner feel is what they are going for, but what the hell........ Noise/sound level: LOUD as hell.  CPK is popular because of the offerings and it will almost always be crowded in this location.  You won't really have to yell to your guests, but you might have to speak louder than desired. Menu: The menu is on the verge of being gigantic; composed of many different tapas, appetizers, meals, desserts, and drinks.  But, it covers almost every option under the sun so whatever you want, you more than likely can get it at CPK. Service: The wait staff was friendly, accommodating, informative, helpful, and ticket times were as expected considering the amount of people eating. Food: My wife and I frequented CPK twice and haven't really had a chance to go back since.  The first time we went nuts; we had mac and cheese bites, tortilla spring roles, lettuce wraps, the dumplings.  The second time we had spicy sausage pablano and fennel flatbread, fish tacos, and the bianco flatbread.  Overall, I gather some of the food is frozen but the general presentation and flavor is not bad.  The food is fun and tastes as good as a chain restaurant can provide.   Bar: Full.  The fact this place is in the mall and you can get sloshed in it is crazy.  The beer selection is decent considering and the prices aren't too bad. Price: Each plate alone might not cost a lot, but the serving size will trick you.  Once you order a few dishes it will get expensive fast.  I don't think I've left here spending less than $60 for two people.  It's not too big of an issue though; you're here to have fun. Overall: I definitely want to return and try the habanero pizza, but be forewarned your experience might be detracted some if it's busy.  The second time we visited we were packed in like sardines so close to everyone else.  It was so tight I could smell the dude's breath next to me. Also, CPK delivers here, but for $100 minimum. (per their site)
All around not a bad place if you enjoy brick oven pizza. Enjoyed their Thai, Hawaiian, and California Club Pizzas
The food is really good, my wife loves the hearth roasted halibut, my kids order pizza and that's a good size. No five stars because the service is no good, no kind people

The waiter seemed not so happy to have us dining there. With extraordinary poker face and not willing to fake a smile toward your costumer. Pizza is quite nice but they did not score on service which is pretty shamed. I would not go to there again to add more shitty dining experience.

I've eaten here plenty of times and the food itself is consistently ok - a solid 3 stars. However, this evening I experienced such rude service I was compelled to yelp. I was with my parents and 9 month old baby and made a reservation in front of the hostess for 3. When our name was called, the waiter or host Matt looked at us and the baby, clearly exasperated and annoyed, and said we should have said table of 4 and by doing so we could not be seated then because a high chair would require extra set up. He insisted on telling us we should have said 4 if we wanted a high chair. I saw a stack of unused high chairs in the waiting area. It wasn't for lack of high chairs that we couldn't be seated right away. It was rude of him to point fingers so quickly. If there was a question about whether we needed a high chair, they should have clarified this when we made the reservation. I wasn't hiding my baby.  Goodbye CPK. Last time I eat at a place that likes to place blame on potential diners instead of remaining calm and respectful in innocuous and common situations such as these.

CPK, how do I even begin to describe your awesomeness!  From your delicious appetizers to your amazing pizza concoctions you are heavenly.  I hate ordering salad when I go out because why but your salads are so fantastic and flavorful that I don't feel lame ordering them.  Service at this location is always on point as well.  Man, just writing about it... now I want CPK, I guess I shall be seeing you tomorrow then!

Found it in the WestField Mall. I had no idea of this branch but so happy to see. Checked in around noon on Saturday. It was not so crowded. Started with Fresh and soft bread with Olive oil. Never had such soft bread at any Restaurant. The waitress was nice and asking for anything required oftenly. I was with my husband who is a pizza eater. So we ordered a chipotle chicken pizza and chicken lettuce wraps.  Chipotle Chicken Pizza- 4/5 It was as usual as other CPK(Amean in California), it came with ranch sauce but it was tasty w/o the sauce. The only thing I felt bad about the pizza, it was cold. Chicken Lettuce Wraps- 4/5 Loved them, so crispy the chicken and the filling was but was very oily. It came with 5-6 fresh lettuce wraps. Overall it was a nice experience cz I love CPK :) Dint have their dessert but will try it soon.

In a word Disappointing.  All be it, it is two days after Christmas and the mall is as busy as a bee hive. This was our first time here. The experience was a disappointment.  When we first arrived we asked how long was the wait and were told 15 minutes.  We were a party of 5 with 3 children.  Three hungry children and we waited almost an hour not 15 minutes as promised for a table.  By the time we sat down we were all so hungry the entire menu looked delicious and by delicious I mean I was ready to eat paper. Our server appeared blissfully unaware of our wait.  He suggested a couple of cocktail off the drink list but never bother to suggest that we get the lunch special which would have saved us quite a bit of cash given we ordered a salad and one pizza to share. The mixed drinks were not good and we left them almost completely full. Our food did come out quickly actually before the driinks ever made it to the table. We got the quinoa arugala salad and the chicken artichoke pie.  Both were very good.  The portion of the kid's meals were pretty large size but the orders came out all wrong.  We just couldn't wait for the remake.  I'm hoping it's not always like this but who knows since this was our first visit.   All and all 3 kids meals.with kid drinks, two cocktails, one pizza and one salad came to 85.00.  We should have just gone to the food court would have been quicker and cheap.

I can't believe they charge for a little bit of extra sauce.  At every restaurant I go to, I always ask for a tiny bit extra sauce cause I don't like my pasta dry. Never have I ever been charged extra.  I asked the server for extra sauce and he said there would be an extra charge and I said no thanks then.  He did it anyway and charged me for it.  Way to listen jerk. Not coming back here for a while.  I rather go to UNO's.

The wait was about 15 minutes for a party of 3 on a Friday afternoon, which isn't terrible. The waiter was really nice and tried to to be attentive, but it was just so busy in the restaurant that it was hard to be. I got the Blackberry Bramble as my drink, and it was really good. It's made of Bacardi Limon and ginger beer, with lemonade and blackberries. We also got the Avocado Club Egg Rolls to start, which were delicious as always. I ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti as my main, which was a little disappointing because the noodles tasted overcooked. Finally, we got the Butter Cake for dessert, which tasted pretty average. The bill came out to almost $100 for lunch for three people, which is very overpriced. Maybe not a place that I'll come to often, but pretty solid food after a long morning of shopping.

California pizza has always been one of my favorite family restaurants, but this changes from my horrible experience last Saturday.  One of the waiters had an accident and poured the entire plate of Thai peanut sauce on my favorite sweat shirt.  I tried wiping it off but without any success!  The middle of my sweater looked like puke on it :( The restaurant manager Jesse Eyrich came for this situation which made matters a million times worse.  He was rude and humiliating.  He said  that he can give me $5 to buy a new sweater at JC Penny or bring back the dry cleaning receipt for reimbursement.  Where do you get a $5 Nike sweatshirt?!  Or any sweater that's $5?! It was a totally nasty dinner (food was great, it was the service).    I got $20 off my check but my entire night was ruined by a rude manager.

I came here just because I had a coupon for a free flatbread and because it was late and we were starving. The food looked really good but I wasn't too happy about it.  Guacamole tasted really good but was a very very small portion. I would suggest charging a couple bucks more and making it a bit larger.  The flatbread was ok, nothing special. The pizza is what I didn't like at all. The dough felt like toasted soggy bread and the toppings were all over the place with barely any chicken. I mean maybe like 3 tiny pieces.  I don't recommend and don't think I'll be coming back! Sorry!
Best gluten free pizza ever!!! Healthy and delicious options. Try at the end the belgian chocolate soufflé cake. You will simply dye for it!

Meh, super meh. Didn't like this at all. 40 bucks for 2 pizzas? Really? I could have gotten better pizza from any of the pizzerias in Bayonne. I ordered a thin-crust Sicilian pizza and it was so damned hot (spicy hot, not heat hot) that it was almost inedible. I like spicy food and thought this was awful.  The place was filthy. The bathroom was a disaster. The women's room had one toilet out of service, another sporting a huge mess (what woman takes a dump that large?) and a very messy accessible stall. Ugh. It was before 5 in the evening and it was already that disgusting? Really? Service was strange, hard to describe. It ran both hot & cold.  I wouldn't have given even two stars except my friend said the gluten-free pizza was pretty good.

Typical chain restaurant. It was my first time experiencing this chain and I was impressed with the large selection of pizza. I loved the choice I made, their new carne asada however I did find this place to be pretty pricey. For a carne asada pizza and a kids size plain pizza, I ended up spending over 30 with tip and everything.

Took my kids to the restaurant at my son's request since he just graduated from 8th grade. On our way there, I was telling them that a few years back, they had a carne asada pizza to die for but they no longer have it. The kids asked me why did the restaurant discontinued that pizza, I informed them that probably it was a slow mover.  We get to the place and the hostess was not as cordial that I would wanted her to be but sometimes that happens. We got a table and we started to view the menu when my daughter pointed out to me that they had a carne asada pizza and it was a new item, I was glad and of course, I ordered. The waitress was very friendly and helpful (she would get an A for service). The food was delicious and I would come back again and again. Thank you

So sad to see how much this place went down hill. Came here on a Sunday recently.  After being ignored the first 3 minutes, we saw a girl behind the bar and said 'excuse me' to get her attention.  She was the nastiest person I ever interacted with at a restaurant.  'YES?!' As if we interupted her life (not task, life) I asked if we entered the restaurant properly and if there was a hostess.  She snapped again 'WELL WHAT DO YOU WANT' we were shocked.  We asked if they were open and if we could be seated, she started looking around like we were idiots.  We were so taken back, finally someone came from the back and asked if we wanted to be seated.  We immediately asked what the woman's problem was.  We even offered to leave because we couldn't understand why she was so unbelievably nasty to us.  Our waiter apologized a few times for that woman's behavior.  The best part was she was wearing different clothes than everyone so I assume she was a manager (the nasty woman behind the bar). Things calmed down.  We ordered 2 five cheese pizzas with sauce.  We were sat next to the window, facing the inside of the mall.  The plates, napkins & utenesils were behind us on a ledge filled with 1/4 inch of dust & dirt.  I am confident that the ledge hasn't been wiped down since 2015, more so 2014.  Besides that, the window was FILLED with fruit flies.  I am talking at minimum 14 and max 23 each time I counted.  It was so gross.  It was very telling to the cleaning habits of thos restaurant. The food went down hill.  The pizza wasn't even half as good as I remember.  Pizza dripped with oil. We won't be back.  Shame as I used to love CPK.

I came here for lunch on a Friday afternoon. The hostess said the wait was 5-10 minutes; I was surprised, but we were seated in around two minutes.  The server was quick and attentive despite the restaurant being busy. If it's this crowded on a Friday afternoon, though, I suspect it can be packed on Friday or Saturday nights.  Regardless, we both got lunch specials. I ordered the mushroom and spinach lunch sized pizza with the spinach and quinoa salad. The food came quickly and was pretty good! Not stellar, but in my experience CPK does not have food to write home about.  If you want a cheap and fast lunch at GSP I'd probably go with something in the food court, but I think this is a great option if you want to be served. While CPK doesn't have amazing food I think the GSP location is a good lunch option.

Summary: Unusually bad experience dining here. Came to California Pizza Kitchen after a long time, as we remember it being reasonably good. This time, however, service was painfully slow during the whole time. Food wise, the Caesar salad dressing was odd tasting (perhaps stale), croutons were definitely stale.  Pepperoni pizza was too spicy and heavy on sodium. Marinara sauce requested on the side was also stale.  Lemonade didnt seem fresh at all. Hope they improve themselves going forward.

Food is food with many varieties of pizza topping choices.  Appetizer 'Spinach artichoke dip' is so tasty my whole family loves it!  A 5-year old boy next table was celebrating birthday.  The waitress named 'Rainbow' sang the birthday song.  Her voice is so strong and powerful.  It's the extra enjoyment we had there.   I received a Perk coupon from California Pizza's app, it saved me $15.  What a good deal!   The overall environment is happy atmosphere with loud music, so if you are looking for a quiet/romantic place, this is definitely not the one.

So this was my second visit here and of course, I cannot complain. This is the first restaurant where I actually sat at the bar to order my food and I realized you get your food MUCH faster when you sit at the bar (wink wink, nudge nudge).  I got the Pesto Cream Penne and doused it with hot sauce :-) Absolutely delicious! I added chicken with it. Last time, it was chicken + shrimp. I also tasted the Hawaiian Pizza but I made the mistake of putting hot sauce on it because I love putting hot sauce on everythang.. but pineapple and hot sauce do not mix. Keep that in mind! Next time I visit, I must try the alcoholic beverages. Sitting at the bar and watching the bartender make those pretty drinks has me wanting to come back just for those! Oh and if you don't like it when restaurants are crowded, go to CPK after 5:00pm, that's when it's less crowded, and surprisingly on a Friday night!

Came here with a friend on a busy Saturday. We had a wait when we arrived, but it wasn't bad and was within the 15-20 minutes they said it would be. Our waiter is the reason I'm not rating this California Pizza location with a higher rating. He didn't really greet us and asked us what we wanted as if he was needing to move away from us in 5 seconds.  My friend and I shared the guacamole and chips for an appetizer and the wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil. They were both really good. We also each ordered sangria. For the amount they charge, they give you a good sized drink. We also wanted to order dessert, but our waiter didn't ask if we wanted any and brought us our check.  Wanted to rate this place higher. I hope to get better service if I come back here again.

Amazing food and amazing service.  We were seated right away on a busy Saturday,  Get the full sized salad, you won't be disappointed!  Everything tasted fresh and made to order.  The Moroccan Chicken salad was great (if you like extra dressing make sure you ask for it on the side, as they don't drown your salad in it). Just wish it was spicier. The Roasted Garlic and Chicken pizza was also really tasty and fresh.  Had great flavor! Our waitress was friendly, quick and attentive. Best part was we didn't have to keep asking her for refills on our soda! The complimentary bread with olive oil is a nice touch.

Been coming here for years but I do have to say you are getting less for what you pay for these days.  $15 pasta dish and you get a small portion.  They compensate that by using a XL plate.  $24+ for small portion of halibut.  Pizza still good, smaller dessert menu (5).  Sign up for the rewards program, you get fee valet parking if you spend over $30.  Still good food and service, just not worth the price.

An above average restaurant for pizza and drinks. For a chain, it is surprisingly good. The main problem here is the long wait, to get inside and for food. Due to its location (inside a busy mall), this place is always full. I like their sicilian pizza.

It's a pretty good place to eat while at the GSP, since I usually avoid food courts at all cost. Expect some wait time if you go in groups. They have bar seating area which is perfect if you're just by yourself.  I surprisingly didn't come for pizza. I had chicken picatta instead which I thought was sooo muuch chicken. The blanco flatbread was pretty good too. Download their app "CPK Dough" on your phone, and when you check in the first time, you get 1 free item from the small plate menu

Came here today with a few friends for lunch. It wasn't crowded at all and we got seated rite away. As we sat down we were greeted by our server and he took our drink orders and gave us a few minutes to order. I ordered the white corn guacamole with chips and it was very refreshing and crisp. I also ordered the macaroni and cheese bites that were coated in panko bread crumbs and fried to a perfect golden brown. It was served over a cheese sauce that was to die for. My fried ordered the spring rolls that were served with guacamole on the side. My boyfriend and I ordered the garlic chicken pizza that was very yummy. My friend got the tostada pizza and didn't like it so she got the garlic chicken pizza as well. For dessert we ordered the chocolate soufflé cake that was amazing it came with vanilla ice cream and a vanilla bean sauce that was lighter than a cloud.

One of my favorite restaurants at Garden State Plaza.  It is extremely casual and a great place to grab a bite to eat after a day of shopping.  It is usually extremely busy and you will have to wait, but it is worth it.  The strawberry lemonade is delicious and I always get the tri colore pizza (salad pizza) which is scrumptious! Also!  If you are going to the movies after, tell your waitress, you can buy movie tickets at a discounted price!

Our server was so sweet. She sang my baby girl a lullaby before we left and I thought it was the most amazing thing for someone to do. Not very many ppl go above and beyond that way. I wish I remembered her name. When I go back I will find out and update this!

I usually eat at CPK often and its always a solid 3-4 stars, but the last visit I had here was different. We asked for mac and cheese bites and they had ran out, no biggie. The kitchen kept dropping plates and it was quite annoying. I got the BBQ Chicken Pizza and Chipotle Chicken Pizza. The second I took my first bite I knew something was wrong, my partner said it was fine. But I told her no the cheese seems bad, right after eating our pizzas both our stomachs hurt.

Just had a pretty good meal. I am not really into chain restaurants but this place was close to route 17 where I had been shopping earlier.  Our server and the service was way above average. Rob was so attentive, nice and helpful. I really love good service and we got it here!! We started with a bianco flatbread. So good!!! Anything with cheese, truffle and sage is heaven on earth in my book. Shared the kung pao chicken and a thai crunch salad with my dining partners. Both were good and just enough food for 3. Since we weren't stuffed we went with the butter cake for desert. Rob convinced us to get ice cream with it, claiming it'd be sacrelig not to. So glad we listened!  Loved the variety of ethnic dishes, delicious desert and the service!!

Finally, they redid the whole restaurant.  same  menu, with many more options, specials. great beer menu.  I love the mushroom and sausage pizza, great crust.  My wife usually has a salad [half size, the full size is enough for 3-4 people} which are great. glad they fixed it up[ as it is our favorite pizza "joint"

Please check your food before you start eating. Ordered Thai crunch salad with no meat and server gladly told me that he will make sure not to add it and will substitute it with avocado. Before leaving the takeout counter and checked with server again to make sure it has no meat whatsoever and he answered affirmative. I was few bites in and a piece of chicken came in my mouth, which made me throw up in my car. Jesse the manager was kind to refund the money but at the same time he was rude about certain things.... Check your food before you eat !!!! And if you allergen please check and confirm 100 times as there are times their servers are also not sure about the contains. God bless you for eating food without checking at any CPK.

I love this damm place very good food every time. Their Chicken Fettuccine Pasta is awesome and my personal favorite is the Bar B Que Chicken Pizza which is a can't miss everytime I get it. For dessert you must try the Butter Cake you will not be disappointed and honorable mention is their Red Velvet Cake as well.

Amazing food!! Very delicious hot and fresh!! Great place inside ...customer service is excellent ..I love this place a lot!! This is true pizza !!! I honestly hate pizza but theirs I love!! Will be going here often!! I recommend the Tuscan hummus

I love the bread & oil and atmosphere here!!! The food is good but that's because I'm picky and I've only tried a few things from here. The first time I came here I got penne pesto and the pasta wasn't fully cooked to al dente! I decided to give this place more chances and increasingly everything has gotten better and I love it! The chicken milanese I did not like at all. I had the Chicken fettuccini tequila pasta but it could be creamier. I come here mostly because my boyfriend loves it. From what I ate from here I usually go with the Chicken Fettuccini Tequila or Pesto Cream Penne. The bread & oil is by far my favorite thing from there though!
Amazing food, great sangrias, and nice staff! I was here last week and I had an amazing time just sitting at the bar with my friend, will definitely go back again!

Great italian food. They have good selection of wine and their olive oil that is served complimentary die for. We always sit at the bar as it is fun to watch kitchen... Good place, highly recommended!!
This place was better than my experience today. I was very disappointed today in my regular pizza

Stay clear of this place. The staff is rude, the manager argues with the customers and if you order the garlic chicken, be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes while the staff turns chicken breast that should take only a couple minutes on top of the stove to cook, into shoe leather because they BAKE it, despite it being deboned chicken. The sauce is over salted. The vegetables few and far between. The only good thing about this place is their pizza and their salads. But with an attitude of "the customer is not right" this is a place to avoid. I spoke with the manager to tell him we waited 20 minutes for the chicken and there was no apology just an announcement telling me that the way they cook chicken takes 20 minutes. When I asked him why it wasn't stated as such on the menu, he said the problem was 'corporate' and that maybe he would notify them.  The music was turned up to strength ten and my husband and I had to ask the gal who waited on us, twice, to please turn down the music. She finally did but not eagerly. Avoid this place because you can get very good pizza, pasta and salads elsewhere. There is no reason why anyone should have to be treated rudely while paying for a meal anywhere.
Service was great here my server Brea was really nice and attentive.  The food was ok.  I love the avocado egg rolls but the spinach dip wasn't that great.
The place is clean, pizza is good. The lettuce wrap appetizer was my favorite part. That all I really have to say.

Good affordable food and good service!!!  I luckily have an enjoyable experience each and every time I come here.  We always order the corn guacamole with chips and quesadillas for starters and the delicious Waldorf chicken salad (one of the best restaurant salads ever).  Decided to also try something different today and ordered a lunch special (1/2 sandwich and salad) turkey sandwich with Brie and pear on toasted ciabatta and Cesar salad ($9.95) and a grill Cedar Plank salmon dish that came with roasted corn succotash and feta ($18.99). Food was really yummy.  All in all, very positive experience especially given it was packed today on Presidents Day. This restaurant however need to invest into those electronic devices for managing the waiting list or like the Short Hills CPK location where they take your phone number so you can go shopping.  When your table is ready then you will get a text.  No wasting time sitting around waiting for your table.
Caribbean Sunset Sangria is the best....very refreshing. The service is good, food is great. But they need to do a better job with the bathroom. It is always dirty.

THE BEST PIZZA PLACE IN THE WORLD!  I love CPK - it is a special treat to go here.  Not only is the food amazing, but the service is always perfect.   I went out Wednesday evening with a close friend.  Our server, Megan, was more than helpful.  We liked her so much, we wanted her to join our dinner and sit with us.  She was so nice, kind, and knowledgeable about all of CPK's products.  She made our experience that much better! I had the whole wheat Margarita Pizza, which was to die for.  I love going here and will continue to go!  It is a little trip for me, but so worth it!

The best gluten free pizza around hands down!!! For those of us with gluten sensitivities it celiac this place is a must! They have a separate prep station and a pretty decent selection on GF items! This place is a must try, you won't be disappointed!

The two hostess were outstanding! Our waitress Megan was very helpful. As a appetizer we had the chicken lettuce wraps. My wife's Waldorf salad was delicious. I had a white cheese pizza. We will be coming back here again!

I came to this location for my usual - the waldorf salad. I ordered take out. When I got home, to my disappointment, I realized that they used a different kind of chicken in the salad. I was highly upset. I would have rather been told that they didn't have the chicken/ ingredients to make the salad than for them to substitute in a different kind of chicken. Will not be returning.
Apps and drinks are good... But they're known for their customizable pizza. Definitely try the Thin Crust Tostada Pizza with Salsa

*This rating is based on the vegetarian pizza options only* I have to thank my brother-in-law for picking CPK for lunch on one of our weekend trips to Garden State Plaza and it has since become our preferred spot whenever we are at GSP.  The bread and dipping oil they served while we waited for our pizzas was fresh and soft.The server was really nice and helped us with the various vegetarian substitutions we could make. We ordered the Spicy Chipotle chicken(without chicken), the California Veggie and the Thin crust Tostada pizza. All three looked clean and well made. My husband and brother-in-law did not like the tostada too much as it was a little bland for their taste. They ordered their pizzas with extra jalapenos. I happened to liked it though. The spinach artichoke pizza is really good too. We end up ordering atleast one of the above mentioned pizzas everytime we are at CPK. The taste and presentation has been consistent(not just at this particular location but at all the CPKs we've been to) on every single one of our visits  and we have never had to wait for more than 5-10 min.The iced teas are alright.

What started out somewhat promising, turned to general disappointment. After years of passing by this chain-restaurant, we spontaneously decided to give it a try. They had 2 hostesses out front, but rather than offer seating options, both just said "hello" to us. We sat at the bar/counter and were told by a waitress that she'd be "a few minutes." That should have been our cue to depart. After about 5 minutes, she returned to take our drink order. She returned promptly with both drinks & took our food order. The salad & wine arrived promptly, but that's when time stopped. We waited and watched as several other diners, one right next to us and each having arrived after us, were served appetizers & main courses. Also, right next to our seats was the take-out station, where at least 3 people came in, ordered & left with their food before us. This is when we inquired about our order, only to be told twice that it would be delayed; "we're really backed-up" - even though there were several tables & seats at the counter empty. Finally after another 5 minutes, we were told by who we assumed to be a manager, that our food "should be out soon." Then I noticed the guy seated next to us rolling his eyes & shaking his head, so we told her we were done waiting. That's when my fish arrived, but my wife's pizza was just going into the oven. Yes, we could see all of the kitchen activity. Maybe they should re-look that feature. I will say they were all very apologetic and the manager even told us there would be no charge for our salad & drinks, which was unexpected & appreciated. Of course we gave the waitress a reasonable tip. But, had I been managing there, I would have "comped" the appetizer & drinks sooner. (Btw, the La Crema Pinot Noir was very good!) So, will we try California Pizza Kitchen again? Maybe, but not in the near future.

CPK didn't really hit it out of the park for me. The food was good, but I was expecting it to be better -- especially because there is always a ton of people here. For appetizers my table ordered the Bianco Flatbread, which is a small plate & a new menu item. I was a fan of this, because the flatbread is drizzled with truffle oil and you can pretty much put truffle oil on anything and I'll love it. We also ordered the  Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla and the ranchito sauce that it came with really made this dish a hit.  It was REALLY good. As part of our main dish, we shared the California Club, Lettuce Wraps, and the Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings. The pizza crust was really good but I probably wouldn't get the California Club again. It was pretty much salad on a pizza. It made the pizza difficult to eat. The service was pretty good. Our waiter told us about their app and if you download it, you get a code for a free small plate.
Pizza was good bread was a little hard though overall pretty good and I will defiantly come back
First time I've ever tried CPK. We got the signature bbq chicken bacon pizza. Surprisingly very good! Would def eat here again
Loved my time here! Our waitress, Tiffany, was amazing! Helped us choose our entrees, and even before I was finished with my soda, a new one was waiting for me. Definitely coming back

My friend's mother wanted to eat out with me. WIthout my friend. Yes it was a little strange hahah. But it was a Thursday for party of 2. At CPK, you can call ahead 30 minutes to put your name on the waiting list though they don't necessarily reserve. I called ahead for 5:45 PM but when we got there, there were a plenty of empty tables. The traffic around the area at that time is an absolutely pain as everyone heads home for work or out for dinner, so you can expect the mall parking to be kind of horrendous too. Oh that's another thing, it's actually inside the mall, not like one of those restaurants that have a direct outside entrance. We were able to get a free Small Plate by registering with the CPK app on my smartphone. Jessica, our server, was quick to take down my account number and immediately put it into the system (grateful! I read about how much of a hassle getting this free small plate was at some CPKs). We got the White Corn Guacamole & Chips. Came out in a matter of 2 minutes-- awesome!! The amount of guac they give you is about 3 tablespoons. A lot less than we expected for the amount of chips we got. However, good and I s'pose it is afterall just an appetizer. I just think they should portion the ratio better. We ordered the California Club and the Kung Pao Spaghetti, both to share. When Jessica took our orders, she reassured us that they were great selections! Especially being a first time visitor. We waited about ten minutes and Jessica refilled out waters in between. Food came out. Though the California Club didn't have that zangy tangy kick I was looking for like in a BBQ pizza, and appeared rather unappetizing because it looks like a salad on top of a pizza, I actually enjoyed it! It did not feel like a guilt-heavy pizza. There were pieces of bacon throughout and the lemon-pepper mayonnaise was the most flavorful. I don't think I'd get it again though. The KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI however was bursting with flava! The shrimp was so very perfect. Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked. Noodles were a little more than al dente but not anywhere near mush which is what I LOVE. It also was a little spicy and just had all the right combinations to round out a good twist on a Chinese classic. I think this dish would be great for asian parents who don't typically enjoy going to non-asian restaurants because it doesn't "fit their taste". Jessica, being pregnant, was so on top of her game. Checked back once, and came back to drop the dessert menu once (which we didn't have room for). I saw her from my peripheral waiting on standby for any of our needs, but never intruding, bothering, or rushing us. We spent a full hour & 15 minutes there in wonderful conversation. She filled my water a total of three times and was the kindest. Bill came out to $30. Left a 20% tip, totally deserved! Go Jessica. CPK Management if you see this, praise her!

So we went to the movies and decided to try out the pizza kitchen... Way too busy to feel like you are getting good service. The server was great the food was okay average mass-produced food. Hard to keep a conversation with the busy atmosphere unless you like that.

I've been walking by this place since I was a child and never went in. I've been here twice already and love it. I'd recommend the Jerk Chicken Pizza. All the appetizers I tried were amazing too. Will definitely frequent this often.

I've been to this place couple of times trying to understand why it gets so crowded. Pizza is below average at the best. Last time I ate there chicken garlic pizza and quinoa salad my stomach hurt. Pizza crust was burnt crust and salad looked stale. Service was slow even though it was a weekday and place was half empty. Nothing appealing about this place. Won't be back

I came into this CPK with an average expection, and they beat it! - Since is was friday night (super busy) we called 1 hour ahead to put our name down (it is not a formal reservation, but it holds your place in the waiting list).  I would suggest to do that for any weekend night.  We only had to wait 5 mins to get a table for 10. - Service was surprisingly quick even during the busiest time of the week. - The food was above average: we ordered 4 kids meals, 4 entree pizzas and 2 full salads for 4 kids and 6 adults.  The salads were refreshing and surprisingly exotic, and the pizza was above average.  The pizza wasn't burnt or under cook in anyway.  It was cooked perfectly with the golden crust.   - Surprisingly the bill wasn't too hard on the wallet too! I would probably go back here if I had a craving for pizza while shopping at Garden State Plaza. ENJOY!
Decent pasta and pizza, but the wait can be very long especially during weekend nights.  Be prepared.

Not a bad place if you are in the mall and looking for something better than the food court.  The spinach and artichoke dip with tortilla chips is my fav appetizer here. Pizzas are ok.....somewhat pricey. Wish the crust was a bit more crispier.  Red velvet cake was good and their coffee was excellent.  Server was very proficient, but a little too gabby for my liking.

LOVE it here.   Food: Oddly, I never get pizza, as they lack flavor (most have no tomato sauce) but everything else here is delicious.  My favorite dish is the Chicken Milanese, which comes with Arugula, tomatoes and shaved parmesan.  The mac & cheese is also great.  The corn guacamole appetizer is a must.  Drinks: Sangria all the way.  Not strong at all but very delicious. Service: Oddly enough, the CPK's in NJ have much better and quicker service than the ones in NY.

on new years day, this was one of the few restaurants that were open although the rest of the mall closed early. i almost feel apologetic when i show up to a restaurant these days with 5 people. it is such an odd number, the hostesses just doesn't know what to do with us. At CPK, there were only 2 tables that can accommodate this and they knew right away where to seat us. the food was excellent but took a little longer than i'd hoped for (admittedly i was starving from a 7 hour shopping spree and woodburry right before). my favorite dish is the hummus appetizer, the pita is so warm and soft, not to mention fragrent.

Being lied to and given a load of BS is not the way to treat customers. Been coming to this California Pizza Kitchen for years, but I've had my last straw.  Usually the BS comes from the waitstaff/hostess where they would say that, "Sorry that your server got the order wrong, she being replaced anyway," but of course the same server is there day in and day out.  What really got me this time was when we had a group of six people, and being told that we had to wait till the appropriate table that could fit six was cleared.  The whole establishment was empty.  There was no one eating there at the time, and there are no barriers to obstruct our view of that.  Then another group of five asked to be seated, and they were seated immediately at a table that could fit six.  Our party offered to even help them move the tables so we could join three two person tables together to fit six, but they told us that would be a violation of fire code.  What kind of BS is that?!?  After waiting 45 minutes at a largely empty California Pizza Kitchen, we left vowing never to patron this establishment again.

3.5-4 stars. I've been here twice and enjoyed it both times. I had the Greek pizza last time. I love it how you can ask for thin crust. It was pretty decent. This time I had the Moroccan Chicken Salad which hit the spot. It has a little bit of everything and what I did like is that they didn't drench the salad in dressing like most places do. For some reason I hate that & I usually ask for dressing on the side.  Even though it was pretty quiet this time, I felt like it took as long for the food to come out as it does on a busy day. I liked how the waitress knew her customers and catered to them accordingly. (ex: She asked if we wanted anything else but water, perhaps Oktoberfest on draft with our meal. An older couple came later & sat behind us - she asked if they would like a glass of wine with their meal, etc).

Don't know what the heck was going on last Saturday, but honestly, I really don't care either. I will say that the entire experience is A LOT worse during the dinner rush at 7 in the evening than at 4 pm.  First off, the beeping guest pager was not working right (Haha, unintentional pun on "beeping"). It would beep when I was more than 5 steps from the entrance, even though the hostess assured me that it works all the way down the hall.  The hostess who sat us made this HUGE fuss about how we didn't specify that we needed a highchair when we first put our names down, even though we have NEVER been asked about it that early. I think it's completely unprofessional to blame US for this. She put the three of us into a booth that would have fit 6 people (the only bright spot of the experience), and said that a highchair wouldn't fit, but they have a booster seat available (which worked fine). The usual crayons and paper menu was also provided. The server was nice, and we quickly ordered a milk for the little one and just some ice waters for us. We tried out the hawaiian pizza (even though it's not our usual order) and I got a BBQ chicken chopped salad (as usual). We also thought we'd try out the mac and cheese on the kid's menu to keep our little one occupied.  The food was really disappointing.  I was confused at how small my salad looked, and when I was finally able to flag down the server and asked about it, she said that she "thought you ordered the half size." At that point, I realized that unlike my other times, she did not ask me what size salad I would like, and I was too busy trying to save the table top from being drawn on to have noticed. She DID offer to switch my salad to a full sized one, but I was SO hungry and it took such a long time to flag my server down that I was just like... whatever. This was my choice, one that I bitterly regret, to this day. My husband's pizza was RIDICULOUSLY small. I mean... Other $14 pizzas are hanging off the side of the plate, and his didn't even make it to the inside rim. It was at least 2 inches (which in a circle is a big deal) smaller than the other pizzas we saw coming out of the kitchen. I don't know what the hell happened but quality control was completely lacking that day. The taste was only OK, since we tried something new, and didn't like it, I would have liked to ask the server to change it for our usual order (per their menu suggesting that we try something new)... but again, not being able to find your server just means that the kitchen will get less complaints (as most of us just throw up our hands and say "screw it"), and more bad Yelp reviews.  The mac and cheese was absolutely atrocious. The pasta was cooked a bit under, which is OK if you're an adult as some people like that, but less acceptable when it's for a very young kid (and a baby, none-the-less).  Maybe next time, we need to specify that the pasta be fully cooked, but I would have thought that to be obvious. Also, there was SO little cheese sauce, that it was just a macaroni dish. When we were finally able to find our server, we asked for more cheese sauce, and granted, she was good about bringing that. But again, not sure what was going on that day. At least their private bathrooms had a changing table, which I did appreciate (and use). Overall, this was an extremely disappointing meal and I will not be coming back to this location. I've had very good experiences at the Willowbrook Mall location, and will head out there from now on when the craving hits.

OK pizza.  NY style will always be king. As I was saying, California style pizza isn't amazing in my honest opinion.  This place has some decent beer, a better wine list, and a non pizza menu that is pretty good.  This place can get packed on the weekend and I usually see people eating the pizza.  Not sure why because the rest of the food is much better.  It's a thin crust style, but the crust itself doesn't have that crisp texture of the right taste.  Cheese and sauce aren't anything super flavorful either.  Flavor profiles like California Club or Habanero Carnitas aren't really pizza, they're pizza shaped, but certainly not pizza.  Better alternatives are things like the Fire-Roasted Chile Relleno or Jambalaya Fettuccine.   Bottom Line: The pizza is MEH.  The rest of the food isn't bad and the wine is good (Although a tad overpriced).

I love this place!  Their chicken quasedillas are AMAZING. I order these every time I come here. I also love their pizzas - especially the BBQ one (I forgot the exact name. Maybe its the Chipotle one? Or the California BBQ pizza?)  But I always get those two when I go to CPK!! And it's absolutely delicious.

Stopped here today for a quick bite that would be kinda nutritious. Sat at the counter and ordered a cup of the pea and barley soup. I like pea soup. I mean, I really like pea soup. This is a good one. I think it's a veggie version because there's no hint of ham or any meat in it. Still good and hearty though.  The half Thai Chicken salad was fun, and that's what I was looking for: a healthy fun salad. Lots of nuts, rice noodles, fresh greens, chicken, edamame beans and crunch. They charge $2.50 for about half an avacado added. I went for it and it was a good quality addition. Very good salad size for a half salad. I was stuffed and content.  The folks next to me had pizza, and it looked delicious. Next time I'll do the pie. All looked good and was good. GO THERE!

Well this is just your average CPK. We got here on a Saturday afternoon and as expected the place was packed. Nevertheless we got a table in a timely manner and even got pretty good service. The food unfortunately didn't quite meet our expectations - I've been to a few CPKs in my life and I would rate this below average. Of course, if your other option is the mall food, then CPK is definitely the better choice!
I love this place, the staff is friendly and the food is good. About to try their new menu and a Mango Mango Mojitos crossing my fingers cause I know my Mojitos this better be good.

I'm really not a big fan of chain restaurants, I think Olive Garden & Macaroni Grill are gross....I'd rather microwave a can of beef-a-roni before going there to dinner.    But I really love CPK.  We live very close to the Paramus store in the Garden State Plaza and have been sampling the menu for the 15 years we have lived here.  Some of our favorites: Sandwich:  Grilled vegetables on rosemary foccacia bread. Salads:  Original BBQ chicken:  grilled chicken, tomato, avacado, cilantro, black beans, corn, jicama, crispy corn strips served with bbq and ranch dressing.               Thai crunch:  shredded cabbage with grilled chicken, edamame, crispy wontons in a spicy peanut dressing.             Salad greens:  Field greens, pear, blue cheese, candied walnuts, grilled shrimp in a balsamic vinagrette.   All of these are fantastic!!! Pizzas:   Our favorite is the Thai Chicken Peanut, my son loves the original pizza, my husband recently tried the Carne Asada and loved it. If you have never tried CPK, I suggest going on a Sunday when the retail shops in Paramus are closed so you will have easy parking and don't have to deal with the shopping crowds.

A visit to Aunt Susie's means CPK with the 2 little runts. It is good suburban stuff.  I wouldn't trade these pies for any old corner in NYC or the 718, but you can't go wrong with the Mexican Pizzaa.  Ask for it extra cooked so that crust has a nice crunch to it.  Throw a ton of red pepper on top and your mouth is going Yippe Kay Yay! To cool things down, you gotta go for the BBQ chicken salad. Make sure that they put extra crunchies on it (like mini fritos and extra cilantro.  I know some people have the issue wiith cilantro tasting like soap but if you like that ittle green stuff, ask for a lot of it.  Not THAT little green stuff, just the cilantro please.   I try making my own BBQ chicken salad at home with bbq sauce and fritos, but it tastes like garbage. They do a much better job at this joint.

BEST PIZZA PLACE in New Jersey! I ate at the bar on a busy Saturday night with my mom and sister. I had the BLT pizza, which is basically a salad on cheese pizza. It was delicious. My mom had the salmon and corn succotash. I had no idea CPK served salmon. She really enjoyed it. My sister ordered four cheese pizza on a thin crust, which was also delicious. We shared two amazing desserts: the chocolate souffle cake with a scoop of vanilla Haagan Daaz ice cream (the stuff that dreams are made of) and the apple crisp (divine). The restaurant was packed. The game was on the tv, which was good. There were families, couples, and singles eating there. This place is great for dates or for groups. I WILL BE RETURNING!

Never had a bad meal here.  When I first started coming they had this amazing dish called the Garlic Shrimp Pizza. The pizza menu seems to have gotten shorter. Boohoo they took it off the menu. Otherwise I'd give this place 5 stars. However, the pot stickers, the quinoa salad, the regular pizza, the Kung Pao Spaghetti, and the Thai Chicken pizza all kick butt.
I have been here a few times. Service is always bad and slow. Their pizza is ok.

Service is good, food is not just pizza even though the word pizza is in their name.  Large portions of food so you get your value for the price.  Years ago when I lived in Los Angeles I hated this chain as service and food was not very good but times has changed and so has my mind.  I will revisit again as I do enjoy having a meal here.  Pizza is still not the greatest but the rest of the menu is not bad.  The desert menu is pretty good and the portion is nice and large so save room for it as it is worth it.

I actually like this place but the management sucks. I waited to place an order by the take out counter longer than anyone should while the girl sat on a stool at the end of the bar chatting with other employees while i stood there waiting.

I usually LOVE CPK and I haven't been here in years- the best part of the meal was our server- Rainbow. She was funny nice and attentive. Sis and I split a cobb salad and BBQ Chicken pizza. Both were totally average and I recall the BBQ chicken pizza being much better. I joined the rewards program called "Pizza Dough" on Rainbow's suggestion and I should have done it at the beginning of the meal, I would have gotten a free small plate app. Guess that means I have to go back :)

Friendly service but for a pizza place, this was one of the worst, most overpriced I've ever had. I ordered the Hawaiian Pizza. It hardly had any cheese or sauce, the pie had air bubbles and was very doughy. The pie was the equivalent of about 2 slices of pizza and cost over $12. The place itself has a nicer atmosphere. Maybe their other food is better but I never tried it. I definitely won't get pizza here again. Convenient location inside mall if you are shopping. Overpriced.

They took my favorite dish OFF THE MENU! Can someone please explain to me why they would do that?? When I asked my waiter about it, he said the restaurant cut 20% of their menu!! Meaning that this is just one of their lazy ploys to cut costs!!!  Never going back again. SO DISAPPOINTING.
Another great CPK location to go to. Waiters are nice and friendly. And I can still get the same quality shitake chicken pizza and Chinese chicken salad that I got in LA.  Beautiful!
I liked the quinoa and arugula salad, flat bread pizza and roasted veggie salad my husband had. The place is good in pizzas too. A regular to this place , whenever we come to GS Plaza.

The menu was all over the place.  An establishment called CPK shouldn't  have Asian items on it, IMO.  I just can't imagine they'd be any good, as it should be all about the pizza, no?  Anyway...just had to get that one off. Their signature BBQ chicken pizza was ok, and didn't tast all that iconic as their menu implies, as did the TV special I was watching that featured this pizza and it's creator, who's not affiliated with the company any longer.  Nothing bad about the pizza, yet nothing great, either. Service was good and attentive and the beverage was bubbly and refilled promptly. Go local if you want a slice.  This place was meh.

CPK is usually one of my go-to's, but tonight I was extremely disappointed. I was served salad that was not fresh in the least (brown to be exact) and bread that was stale and hard to chew. Definitely will think twice about returning.

I don't normally go out to eat, but my friends decided to eat here. The restaurant looked clean and the workers were really friendly.  But I was surprised when I saw that the price of one pizza pie was around $13.  One of my friends decided to cut the price with me and we ended up order the Original BBQ Pizza.  The pizza was flavorful. The sauce was delicious and wasn't runny.  The only complaint was that the pizza dough wasn't thick.

I used to frequent this location all the time several years ago.  But after a string of incidents, I will not return here. Twice we received pizza with a hair on it.  Alright, not a huge deal, take it back and remake it....but taking 40 minutes to do so?  Ridiculous. Then, while I was eating on a separate trip, a roach fell from the ceiling and LANDED ON OUR TABLE.  When we alerted the staff to this, they said the store upstairs was having bug problems and laughed it off.  Not acceptable.
Hate the new pizza dough. Tastes like crap!

Just like Sleazeme P. says below... get the duck pizza.  Oh, they have a new salad, the Thai crunch salad.  That is yummy... forget about the Chinese chicken salad, the Thai crunch is here to stay!  **edit** The peking duck pizza is no longer on the menu.  I have verified that even a SD location removed it as well.  Replace it with the Milan neopolitan pizza.  It is a good substitute.  So long peking duck... we had a good tour.

The food is delicious and the the décor/ambience befitting a much pricier restaurant. We always enjoy our meals here. Last time, I had their ravioli stuffed with sun-dried tomatoes. Portions were limited but the dish was delicious. You cannot avoid a 10-15 minute wait here, but it is well worth it.

All their food is delicious - even their salads. My favorite is the Italian salad and I think it's just as good if not better than some of their pizzas.  Though their pizza is great too.  I liked the butter cake from here.  Sometimes our waitress/waiter forgets to put in orders here.  Only bad thing I can say.

Went here kind of late after a movie. We were able to sit down fairly quickly. Service was a little slow starting. Got the sangria, I do not recomend this. I got the half waldorf salad which was good. Others got the bbq chicken salad which was also very good. I had never been to a CPK before and did not expect the fast foodish feel of the decor/setup. The prices are fairly decent but not for that style of food. Might try again, the other salads looked great and the pizzas look good as well.

I worked for this place when it opened so I feel this place slightly dramatized my teenage years.  I can tell you this though a white pizza with the various cheeses can make all those work memories melt away.  Great for the family and great deserts.  If you love pizza I would stop by.

I've tried this place many times even going to the Wayne location and i'm never impressed. Everything taste very plain to me. The only reason I keep going is because my girlfriend loves some pizza they make so I try to be nice and put up with it.

Go to the Paramus one.Even at high volume times the service is great and the food is consistant taste wise.ANYTHING you get here will be good I promise.Prices aren't going to put a hole in your pocket and you won't find this variety in pizza anywhere else(despite that it's corporate).Carne Asada pizza,jamaican jerk pizza,tostada pizza and the tricolor pizza(i usually add the chicken.shrimp w balsamic vinigrette=not so great) are hands down the best i've ever had(non traditional type.Lombardi's hands down best traditional pizza ever).Their tortilla soup is amazing(get extra tortilla strips) and the sesame chicken dumplings are a great lighter option to their   has a little bit of everything for everyone's liking.You'll definately leave full and happy.

i normally wouldn't consider going to a pizza place in the mall, but CPK is nuts. the high rating i gave it comes from just one of their pizza topping creations, possibly one of the most ingenius toppings ever. the 'Peking Duck Pizza'  Pan Roasted duck breast, Mozzarella cheese, soy-glazed Shiitake mushrooms, crispy wontons, slivered green onions and cilantro ginger Hoisin sauce. Hoisin sauce on pizza!!?! i was skeptic at first, a disbeliever. even as i was ordering it i was sure it was going to suck. but alas it was one of the best.  the crispy wontons they pour over the pizza gives it a nice crunch. who would've thought bowls of crispy wontons they give you before a meal at a chinese restaurant would expand onto pizza tops. now that's cultural evolution.
I find their pizza just average and way to over priced.  I can get better pizza elsewhere and cheaper.

This place is awesome! I went there a little bit ago with my sister and received great service from Rob! He's awesome! You must try the Jamaican Jerk chicken pizza. If you don't you are truly missing out!

Been going there for few times and turns out that it never disappoints. Being with vegr friend they impressed me with chipotle chicken piZa without chicken very nice one and the side of spicy sauce was great.,,,

We came here on a Saturday night. The entire mall was seriously packed to the gills. We put our name in and after a short wait, we were seated. Then, we waited for what seemed a long-ish period of time. We called it to the attention of our waiter, Justin. He immediately apologized,, raced away for menus, and brought back a complimentary appetizer to appease the hungry group. He didn't have to. He just did it. From then on, service was swift and superb. Justin was personable, funny and efficient. The food was quite good. Each of 5 people ordered something and we all shared an arugula and asparagus salad, a spinach flatbread, avocado appetizer and a pizza or two. All were well prepared, tasty and hot. What Justin couldn't know is that we were preparing for my Mother's funeral the next day and we were all very much depleted, on edge and sad. Sometimes it's just the fact that someone puts themselves out just that little extra bit that can lift your spirit. Justin did that for us.

My husband and I went to lunch here on Saturday 7/7. I had the warm peach salad which was very good. My husband had the chicken caesar sandwich which was ok. The place was very noisy and the tables are very close together. I could hear both conversations on either side of me and was difficult to have an enjoyable lunch.

Went back recently to give them another shot. We were able to get seats quickly and service was spot on. Pizza cheese definitely improved for sure, spaghetti bolognese was delish, and the chicken lettuce wraps were flavorful (although the peanut sauce was on the runny side). My kids also devoured their pizza so we will return!
THe roasted veggie salad was great.. glad I got a half order... that thing was HUGE!  Next time I will share a pizza. It was way too much food. but yummy

CPK is rather classy, considering it's a chain pizza restaurant at the mall.   I like this place. The food is always tasty, though about half the times that I've been there, they've screwed up the orders. We had a going away party for my friend a couple years ago with about 10 people and they probably messed up 8 of the orders. But on my most recent trip, they didn't mess anything up, so I'll assume they've hired more attentive waitstaff.   My favorite is the taco salad pizza, though the mushroom pizza is a close second. The pasta dishes I've tried here were good (for a chain). And we never had to wait very long for our food. The prices are average for the mall in Bergen County. The only downside to coming here is that there is usually a wait. And a long one. Your best bet is to come in on a weekday.
Good food but it lacks in service big big time !!!! Tostadas and artichoke is just amazing with some freshly brewed ice tea!!!

Place has the best mix it up pizza. What I mean is that they definitely challenge the thought process as to what you put on a slice of pizza.  The food is always delicious. The place is always clean and has a good atmosphere. The service is good but the place is always crowded and you feel like you are sitting on top of one another.  Great for a lunch date.

We waited about 30 minutes for a table and the hostesses were super confusing about when our table was ready.  After being told you're up you are asked to stand in a line and seated in that order.  The place is tiny and our table was very crowded - so much so that I worried that others walking by would knock down our soda.  The pizza was just ok - plenty to share or take home - but pricey for what you get.  The waitress was on top of things and brought up multiple refills but then never came back with my wrapped up pizza to take home.

I am not a big fan of chain restaurants but i have to say that i use to like this place.  I haven't been back for a while.  Today i decided to stop by since i was in the mall... and low and behold... they took the one item i really liked off of the menu!  booo!   So, I opted for the carne asaida pizza.  it was okay nothing great, this place will never be the same for me again.
Typical California Kitchen restaurant. Been to a few in the area. This one lacks in service compared to the one in willowbrook.

I've been visiting this California Pizza Kitchen for several years. First and foremost, the pizza here is amazing - if you've never visited a CPK, let this specific one be your first experience. Nothing beats great pizza, quality beer on tap and a view of the mall's atrium for some quality people-watching. This California Pizza Kitchen is located at the back of the Garden State Plaza, which some would view as a good location, whereas others would consider it a huge pain (you'll have to park a significant distance away, and wait for the crossing guard to stop traffic). Due to the popularity of the place and its high profile location, you should expect to wait a good half hour or more during 'prime time', such as Friday afternoons, nights, and especially Saturdays (never mind Sundays - thanks to the idiotic Blue Law in Bergen County, where everything is closed on Sunday, making Saturdays a drudgery on New Jersians). California Pizza Kitchen's specialty are their signature pizzas - there is literally something for everyone there. For those who don't like anything or are plain boring, a plain pizza or one with traditional toppings could always be ordered. So, regardless of if you like barbecue chicken bits, pineapple, avocado, Italian sausage or fresh tomato on your pizza, there's most likely a "themed" pizza that has it. For a heart attack on a platter, try the BLT (yes, that does mean bacon, lettuce, tomato & mayo) pizza! Everything is prepared out in the open, which is a style I personally love as a customer...transparency is good, especially in the restaurant business. (Addition: April 2010): The cheeseburger pizza is here, and oh man, is it good. This California Pizza Kitchen is always busy and packed. My only complaint is that if you don't get a booth seat, you're going to get a tiny square table, and will be practically rubbing elbows with the people next to you - not to mention, you'll be talking over each other's conversations. If you're in a party of two, don't expect to ever get seated at a booth. Personally, I like some distance when I'm at a restaurant of any kind - even a fast food place, and you simply won't have that here. CPK's prices are reasonable. Personally, I can finish an entire pizza on my own, including an appetizer (highly recommend the dumplings) and something for dessert (key lime is my favorite). The pizza size is comparable to a small at Pizza Hut. The waiters & waitresses there are top notch - they never forget about you and are always very courteous. Overall, a great and very unique pizza place that is in one of the most crowded and hectic malls in Jersey.

This place is delicious!! It's not the healthiest and its not terribly unhealthy but if you get a salad you'll be fine! The salads are delicious as well as the pizza!! I like the Waldorf chicken salad with vinaigrette dressing and my favorite pizza is the BBQ chicken pizza! Its not too over priced and the place is clean! The waitresses and waiters are nice, helpful, and quick.
Crispy thin crust is phenomenal! BBQ chicken pizza is good.. But, FYI they pile on the onions. Expect a wait, but it's worth it!
The food is good, but very expensive. The place is always packed and getting a table is hard.

To be honest, whenever i take the family to California pizza kitchen we almost never order pizza cause I think I had better pizzas else where. We always go with kids meal for my son and daughter and for me and my wife we always liked their spagetti kung pao noodle it's the best and lettuce wrap, both a big hit for us. These 2 items bring us to the place once in a while if we're in the mood for it. overall good place to go, friendly staff and good food.

The best cpk hands down. The only ones that rival are the midtown ones. Your order comes out fast and well made. Never had a problem at this cpk  (The one on 56th tried to poison us... then we got free food for it) Go with the shrimp scampi and some focaccia bread. The best part. ALCOHOL!!! DRUNK SHOPPING!!!! coming home with things from the mall you didnt mean to buy.... awesome. I bought some hottness and sickness while drunk....

Pretty good salad and pasta.  I enjoyed this spot for lunch one day in the mall.  However, their service is a bit too spotty and the prices need to be knocked down a little bit, how about a dollar or two too much?  Otherwise, I wouldn't think twice about coming back - but you know they do have good portions....

If you are going for lunch on the weekend try to beat the rush by coming before 1230pm or you'll be waiting a while.  Service was great my waiter was very attentive and kept our water glasses full. He gave us bread right away and took our orders quickly.  Try the wheat hummus for appetizer and Thai chicken pizza. I personally like the crust and the flavor of the dish. My kids loved the Hawaiian pizza mainly because they miss the island itself but I'm sure it was good anyway.

No wait tonight,  our waiter Kevin was great, efficient, gave great suggestions.  I always do the salads but family loves the pizza and Kevin said the butter cake is "life changing".   The kids meals are a great value for the price.  They've re done this location since the last time I've been here.  Really like the decor and ambience.

I love CPK! Went around 2PM and it was packed, but managed to get a table within 10min. The tables were pretty close together, but service was great.  The pizza was really good, but it was cut weird - one of the slices took up almost 1/3 of the pizza. One pizza is definitely too much for one person though. One pizza and a side is probably good for 2. They also had siracha sauce as an add-on, which I thought was interesting! Would try that next time.

Really enjoyed my experience here, service was fine but the food was really good. I had the Baja chicken spring rolls to start which I thought were excellent. Then for my main course the BBQ chicken pizza which was just as good. Honestly thought it was a little pricey for what I got but would go back.

I used to come here all the time for their pizza because let's be honest the pizza is AMAZING. My go to pizza is the veggie pizza because I love the flavor of all the veggies on that perfect slice. Recently I have been trying to stay away from carbs and I have found that their Roasted Veggie Salad is perfect for that! I either add a hard boiled egg or fresh grilled salmon. My boyfriend who loves seafood adds shrimp. It is great!

I usually enjoy the food here,although that mushroom pasta dish is a pass for me. Awesome hummus and pretty good pizza, pasta dishes, salad and even steak! My dad's favorite restaurant so we come a lot.

You do NOT want service like this. I had the worst experience ordering California Pizza Kitchen through GrubHub. I ordered a Chinese Chicken Salad and they forgot the dressing. I called back to see if they could accommodate me and the manager (Vanessa) was extremely rude. She would adjust the price of the dressing off of my bill. That seems to be the least CPK could do. I'm extremely disappointed and will not be eating there again.

I'm a big fan of pizza and this place is one of my preferred spots. Came on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm. Place was busy and crowded as expected but didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes.  First off the server was incredibly nice. Her friendly demeanor made it a pleasant experience. I got the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. I've had it before and it was pretty good but it's been over a year. This time I don't know if they changed it or added something but it's even better and has a spicy kick to it that wasn't there before

Drinks were delicious. Had the Moscow mule and blood orange sangria. The sangria was a little sweet. The Thai chicken pizza's sauce is so yummy. The wild mushroom pizza was very flavorful. Service was good. I would definitely go back.

What happened to this place?  Food is marginal, wait staff do more clowning around than working, including throwing ice at each other!  It is overly noisy and doesn't feel clean.  I used to be a regular...no more.  I went to their website a while back to voice my concerns about this location and was given a "case number".  Still haven't heard back!  Tried it again a few weeks ago and decided that this location, and perhaps chain, have seen their best days.  With all one hears about mall traffic being down, you would think that service and food would be better.  You would think.

I haven't been here since 1999 when I used to work as a hostess during one college summer job. So much has changed including the menu! How could they have gotten rid of the Rosemary chicken and potato pizza?!!!??? We came Friday night and was shocked that there was no wait. I was even more shocked that they added tables on the 2 floor between the booths. Some advice-if the hostess seats you at the first table on the 2nd floor in between the booths asked to be moved. We kept getting bumped around as people were being walked to their tables by the food runners and bussers. Worst seat ever. Our server Brittany however was awesome! She made great recommendations and was really engaging and sweet! Their new agave mojito was watered down, but their strawberry basil martini was delicious. Unfortunately not consistent though because the 2nd martini I ordered was overly sweet and viscous as if they didn't water it down with the alcohol; I couldn't even finish it.  The Moroccan salad was pretty good with a lot of ingredients and flavors going on. The chipotle pizza was awesome, and I especially loved the lime&cilantro creme on it. We then couldn't decide between the Thai pizza or the spinach & artichoke pizza. Brittany suggested getting half and half so we did and I wish we had listened to Brittany from the get go and just gotten the whole spinach &  artichoke pizza, it was aweeeesome!! Great chunks of fresh garlic and the wood burned artichoke is killer. Definitely recommend all the food we had.

Now I know this is called "pizza kitchen" but I am in love with their Quinoa and Arugala Salad in their "Lite Adventures" section.  No matter what salad you get, make sure to try the Champagne Vinaigrette...SO GOOD!  The Quinoa Salad is healthy, fresh, and delicious.  I actually have yet to try their pizza, but their flat breads are around 400 calories for a meal. Not bad.  We usually place our order online (from work office) and it's always ready when they say it will be ready. No complaints with CPK!
