I actually thought that I was going to get a decent pizza, but I was so wrong. Very dry!!! And the service was not good at all. I was so disappointed. I have tasted better pizza, even the two dollar slices are better.

Good place to eat after a day of shopping. Really good chicken lettuce wrap (asked to make it less salty). BBQ chicken pizza was good too with a lot of sauce.   For some reason, there are always a few crying or screaming kids when I'm here. Attentive and polite service.

Conveniently located with in the mall and definitely better than some of the food in the food court, but the food is sub par in my opinion. Nothing about the menu or the food is spectacular or wow-ing. Gets pretty packed at times during peak hours, dint particularly think its worth the wait.

So good! Always worth the wait to get seating. Their Moroccan Spiced Chicken salad is really good and worth a try. Whenecer my best friend and I go we always without fail get the Pear and Gorgonzola thin crust pizza and Artichoke and Spinach pizza, which are absolutely amazing. Service is always outstanding as the staff is always very nice and accommodating

I absolutely love this place.  This CPK, along with the Nordstrom Marketplace Cafe, and Zin Burger are my three favorite restaurants in Garden State Plaza.  Even on busy days, the wait is never terribly long; at most I've waited 15 minutes.  The servers are very friendly and attentive.  This place has a wide selection of different foods, and almost everything that I've tried here has tasted fantastic.   My favorite pizza is definitely the Sicilian Pizza, which is one of their Crispy Thin Crust Pizzas.  It consists of spicy marinara, parmesan cheese, oregano, and basil, combined with a medley of different meats (ham, Italian sausage, salami).  The meats and spices combine to create an absolutely incredible pizza.  I'm usually not a huge fan of crust (don't worry, I still eat crust, I just don't enjoy it), but the crust here is so good.  It's got crunch to it, but is also soft inside.  In addition to the Sicilian Pizza, other thin crust pizzas that are good are the Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Margherita.  The Jamaican Jerk Chicken consists of bacon, onions, peppers, spicy Caribbean sauce, and other flavors that I don't really know, but enjoy the taste of.  This is one of those pizzas that I enjoy 2 or 3 slices, but never seem to finish the whole thing on my own, since BBQ style sauces sometimes overpower the taste.   Other things that taste good here are the Spaghetti Bolognese, which is classic.  Their meat sauce is so much better than anything I can ever hope to replicate at home.  The Jambalaya Fettuccine is pretty good as well.   Another aspect of CPK that I love is that the franchise likes to experiment with new flavors, cuisines, and cultures.  For instance, I once had a Korean BBQ Steak Taco which was so freakin good.  I think it was on their special menu or something, they have really interesting and tasty specials.    The layout of the restaurant is great, fits a good amount of people, and is clean.  They also have a bar with a TV, so if you're on your own, not a bad idea to sit there if you feel awkward sitting on your own.  I always ask for a booth seat when I go, but that's more a personal preference.  I'm looking forward to coming back again and again.

CPK has always been a go-to restaurant of mine. It's a great place to grab lunch or dinner with friends and family, and is a suitable environment to chit-chat for an hour or two. I remember in high school, I used to come here with a huge group of girls on the weekend and talk for hours over some yummy food. I usually get the original BBQ chicken pizza which they are famous for and it is so delicious. I can barely finish it myself! I've recently tried the Thai Crunch salad with avocado, which had lots of veggies, cilantro, peanuts, rice sticks, chicken and all tossed in a sweet peanut dressing. I only got the half salad which was still plenty of food! Every bite was so yummy and full of flavor! I love a good salad. I'll definitely be ordering this again. I also liked that we got warm bread with flavored olive oil in the beginning! It was a nice little appetizer. I only gave this place 4 stars because it's still a chain restaurant and their dishes aren't completely unique.
Love this place. Love the Thai chicken pizza is a favorite. the red sangria is the best. the spring rolls are delicious. love when they have specials. favorite place to eat

I have been here a few times as it's been a staple of the mall forever. They even deliver within the mall if you work at one of the stores. Weekends and nights, there is usually quite a wait for this place.  I do miss their shrimp summer rolls that they used to have (what an amazing appetizer). The pizzas I have ordered include the Thai Chicken and Tostada. But I feel like the toppings always overpower the pizza too much.  And the pizzas are alright. They're not that out of this world.  Being in North Jersey, there are definitely better pizza dough and sauces out there. The pastas are good but very heavy and a little on the oily side. The desserts are huge and delicious though especially anything with chocolate. I love chocolate. The staff is usually prompt and courteous. I have never had an issue at this CPK specifically ever.   However, CPK just feels like a (slightly) higher end version of other chain restaurants (i.e., TGIF, Applebee's). The food is always way more than you need and usually just - it's alright. Not the best, not the worst and it definitely does the job to fill you up.
